text.value: Please enter a valid 10 digit phone number
Please enter a valid 10 digit phone number
Next enter the Obstetric Details of Pregnant Woman
In the last one week how often did he smoke at home?
Is this pattern typical of the last one month?
Was it more than last week
Was it less than last week
In the last one month, on a typical day how many cigarettes would he smoke inside home? (cig/day)
Overall, would you say your husband has reduced smoking inside home in the last three months
Has he reduced smoking outside home in the last three months?
For every family member who smokes answer the following
Has your above family member reduced smoking at home in the last three months?
Tobacco smoke inhaled by you can harm your health
Tobacco smoke equally affects the smoker and the non-smoker who inhales it
Tobacco smoke contains chemicals that may cause cancer, heart and lung diseases in a non-smoker who inhales it
If a woman inhales tobacco smoke during pregnancy, it affects the health of the unborn child
If a woman inhales tobacco smoke during pregnancy, the adverse effects on the unborn child can last for many years of the child’s life
The harmful tobacco smoke remains in curtains, clothes, and bedsheets for a few days after a person has smoked in the home
If a young baby/child inhales tobacco smoke, it affects his/her physical growth and development
Children who inhale tobacco smoke have more medical illnesses, such as cough, asthma, pneumonia etc
If a child inhales tobacco smoke, it can also affect his/her academic performance
If a child plays in a room where someone recently smoked tobacco, it can still affect his/her health
In the last 3 months, how often did you do the following
Move away from your husband when he was smoking
Move your child/children or others away from your husband when he was smoking
Ask your husband to put out his cigarettes when you were around him
Ask your husband to put out his cigarettes when your child/children or other people were around him
Ask your husband to stop smoking at home
Ask your husband to smoke outside
Ask your husband to help you request your family members to put out his/her cigarette or smoke outside
Move away from your family member when he was smoking
Move your child/children or others away from your family member when he was smoking
Ask your family member to put out his cigarettes when he/she was around you
Ask your family member to put out his cigarettes when he/she was around your child/children
Ask your family members to stop smoking at home
Ask your family members to smoke outside
Ask your family members to help you request your husband to put out his cigarette or smoke outside
Ask visitors to smoke outside your home, if they need to
Ask your husband to request visitors to smoke outside home, if they need to
Ask your family members to request visitors to smoke outside home, if they need to
How important has it been for you that your husband reduces/ceases smoking at home?
1 - Not important at all to 10 - extremely important
How ready/willing has your husband been to reduce/cease smoking at home?
1 - Not willing at all to 10 - extremely willing
How confident have you felt about negotiating change (reduce/cease smoking at home) with your husband?
1 - Not confident at all to 10 - Extremely confident
How confident have you felt about negotiating change (reduce/cease smoking at home) with your family members?
1 - Not confident at all to 10 - Extremely confident
Has your husband tried to make these changes (reduce/cease smoking at home)?
1 - No change at all to 10 - significant change/already part of his lifestyle
10 - significant change/already part of his lifestyle
Has your husband continued to maintain these changes (reduce/cease smoking at home)?
1 - No change at all to 10 - Maintained
Currently, which of these statements best describes the stage of change your husband is at
Select one that is most appropriate
Pre-contemplation- My husband is currently not considering change (changing his behaviour of smoking at home)
Contemplation- My husband is undecided/ ambivalent (about whether or not to change his behaviour of smoking at home)
Preparation- My husband has had some experience with change and has made a plan (to reduce/stop his behaviour of smoking at home)
Action- My husband is practicing the new behaviour (has actually stopped smoking at home for a few days now)
Maintenance- My husband has continued his commitment to practicing the new behaviour (of NOT smoking at home for couple of months or more)
Relapse- My husband had stopped smoking at home but unfortunately resumed his old behaviour
Stayed with husband in the last 3- 7 days
Stayed with husband in the last 3- 7 days
Where is the delivery likely to happen?
please write the name of the hospital
Inform pregnant woman that she will be contacted a week prior to the date of delivery
Inform pregnant woman that she will be provided with monetary incentive for letting the team know about the delivery within 24 hours
Inform pregnant woman that the team will visit her soon after delivery to assess the health of the new born

10 - significant change/already part of his lifestyle
Pre-contemplation- My husband is currently not considering change (changing his behaviour of smoking at home)
Contemplation- My husband is undecided/ ambivalent (about whether or not to change his behaviour of smoking at home)
Preparation- My husband has had some experience with change and has made a plan (to reduce/stop his behaviour of smoking at home)
Action- My husband is practicing the new behaviour (has actually stopped smoking at home for a few days now)
Maintenance- My husband has continued his commitment to practicing the new behaviour (of NOT smoking at home for couple of months or more)
